system.description:
[Foundry Note: this weapon won't show any damage on the combat tab because the damage stats are on the ammunition it uses. - Ed.]

 

Allowed Classes

AFPR

 

Details

Some specially-made bows (sold at special cost if at all—GM's discretion) permit the user to add his or her strength bonus to damage inflicted with the weapon. 

 

Range Penalties

Range as Missile To-Hit Penalty
Short (1-60 ft) None
Medium (61-120 ft) -2
Long (121-180 ft) -5
Auto-created for Composite Bow, Long +2

[Foundry Note: an aura has been added, so as to be visible and persistant while a caster moves, to represent the ring effect with a default size of 10' radius.  After it is applied to a caster it can be changed on their details tab to any size up to the stated 10 ft + 3 ft radius/level.

A separate shape effect is given in 20 ft blocks for a caster to detail on a map (in 20 ft chunks) the size of the spell if casting it as a wall. - Ed.]

 

General

A magic user's Wall of Fire does base damage of [[/roll 2d6]] hit points plus 1 hp/level. If the wall is configured as a ring its radius will be 10 ft + 3 ft/level. In all other respects, the spell resembles the druidic spell Wall of Fire.

 

REFERENCED TEXT:

...a blazing inferno of flame in the shape of a wall. One side of the conflagration emits the searing heat one would expect, but the other side emits merely a gentle warmth.

The wall persists for as long as the magic user concentrates upon it.  [Foundry Note: - concentration precludes movement or any other action.  If the druid desires to move they must stop concentrating to do so. - Ed.]

If the magic user does not choose to maintain concentration, it remains for 1 round/caster level. 

The druid may evoke a Wall of Fire in one of two shapes.

Straight wall:

  • up to one 20 ft square per caster level arranged as desired
  • a wall is stationary

Ring:

  • radius of up to 10 ft + 3 ft/level (caster in centre)
  • 20 ft high
  • A ring moves with the caster

 

Saves and Other Impediments

No saving throws are allowed to avoid or reduce taken from the wall.

 

Combat Effects

Passing through the flames inflicts [[/roll 2d6]] hit points plus 1 hp/level. Additionally:

  • Creatures as far as 10 ft from the hot side incur [[/roll 2d4]] hit points of damage.
  • Creatures between 10 and 20 ft from the hot side incur [[/roll 1d4]] points of damage.

Undead creatures suffer worse from the power of this...magic, taking twice the ordinary damage the wall would inflict.

actions.name: Wall of Fire
actions.misc:
Casting Instructions

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • (Optional) to visualize a ring casting, target the caster and click the  "Ring Aura - (C)" action, which has no mechanical function but provides a visual indication of the AOE which moves with the caster
  • (Optional) Use the  castshape action to visualize a wall casting's area of effect (you can delete AOE templates if the Templates menu is active)
    • As the AOE can be shaped within reason to the caster's desire, the castshape provides individual 20x20 "blocks" of AOE which may be built into a specific final AOE by re-clicking the action and placing more blocks
  • If the caster stops concentrating (to move or attack, for example) target the caster and click the  "WOF Post-Concentration - Duration (C)" action to start the finite duration
  • If an undead actor interacts with the ring/wall, apply damage as follows:
    • if the undead actor is between 11 and 20 feet from the wall, target it and click the  "Damage (Proximity 2d4 Fire)" action
    • if the undead actor is between 1 and 10 feet from the wall, target it and click the  "Damage (Proximity 4d4 Fire)" action
    • If the undead actor contacts the wall, target it and click the  "Undead Wall Touch" action
  • If any other actor interacts with the ring/wall, apply damage as follows:
    • if the actor is between 11 and 20 feet from the wall, target it and click the  "Damage (Proximity 1d4 Fire)" action
    • if the actor is between 1 and 10 feet from the wall, target it and click the  "Damage (Proximity 2d4 Fire)" action
    • If the actor contacts the wall, target it and click the  "Wall Touch" action

system.description:
General

The powerful magic words of a Knock spell open doors that are stuck, barred, locked, or even Wizard Locked. Chains (even those that are welded) and chests will also spring open under this spell.

 

Saves and Other Impediments

Doors that operate by gravity, such as portcullises, will not be opened by means of the spell.

If a door is secured by a number of devices, only two will be opened by the spell; a triple-locked door is proof against a single casting of the enchantment.

actions.name: Knock
actions.misc:

  • Cast the spell to burn the memory slot or item charge (this may already have been done)
  • (Optional) Use the  castshape action to visualize the area of effect (you can delete AOE templates if the Templates menu is active)

nwp.name: Appraising
nwp.description: This proficiency is highly useful for thieves, as it allows characters to estimate the value and authenticity of antiques, art objects, jewelry, cut gemstones, or other crafted items they find.

nwp.name: Etiquette
nwp.description: This proficiency gives the character a basic understanding of the proper forms of behavior and address required in many different situations, especially those involving nobility and persons of rank. Thus, the character knows the correct title to use when addressing a duke, the proper steps of ceremony to greet visiting diplomats, gestures to avoid in the presence of dwarves, etc.

nwp.name: Musical Instrument
nwp.description: The character can play a specific musical instrument. An additional instrumental instrument can be added for every extra slot devoted to this proficiency. The character plays quite well, and no proficiency check is normally required.

nwp.name: Reading/Writing
nwp.description: The character can read and write a modern language he can speak, provided there is someone available to teach the character (another player character, an NPC hireling, or an NPC hired for the purpose).

nwp.name: Riding, Airborne
nwp.description: The character is trained in handling a flying mount. The particular creature must be chosen when the proficiency is chosen. Additional proficiency slots can be used to learn how to handle other types of mounts.

nwp.name: Tightrope Walking
nwp.description: The character can attempt to walk narrow ropes or beams with greater than normal chances of success. He can negotiate any narrow surface not angled up or down greater than 45 degrees. Each round the character can walk 60 feet.

nwp.name: Tumbling
nwp.description: The character is practiced in all manner of acrobatics—dives, rolls, somersaults, handstands, flips, etc. Tumbling can only be performed while burdened with light encumbrance or less. Aside from entertaining, the character with tumbling proficiency can improve his Armor Class by 4 against attacks directed solely at him in any round of combat, provided he has the initiative and foregoes all attacks that round.

nwp.name: Rope Use
nwp.description: This proficiency enables a character to accomplish amazing feats with rope. A character with rope use proficiency is familiar with all sorts of knots and can tie knots that slip, hold tightly, slide slowly, or loosen with a quick tug.

nwp.name: Spellcraft
nwp.description: Although this proficiency does not grant the character any spellcasting powers, it does give him familiarity with the different forms and rites of spellcasting. If he observes and overhears someone who is casting a spell, or if he examines the material components used, he can attempt to identify the spell being cast.

nwp.name: Swimming
nwp.description: A character with swimming proficiency knows how to swim and can move according to the rules given in the Swimming section (page 120). Those without this proficiency cannot swim. They can hold their breath and float, but they cannot move themselves about in the water.
